Event.name: Attaching
Event.definition:
<def-root>The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be connected to each other. In the first, the frame includes an <fen>Agent</fen> who attaches an <fen>Item</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen> by manipulating a <fen>Connector</fen>, creating an asymmetric relationship between the <fen>Item</fen> and the <fen>Goal</fen>. In the second, the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches two <fen>Items</fen> to each other, where each serves as a <fen>Goal</fen> for the other, creating a symmetric relationship between the two <fen>Items</fen>. In both cases, the <fen>Connector</fen> remains to bind the two entities (either <fen>Item</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>, or two <fen>Items</fen>), without creating a new entity.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The robber</fex> <t>tied</t> <fex name="Item">Harry</fex> <fex name="Goal">to the chair</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Make sure <fex name="Agent">you</fex> <t>bind</t> <fex name="Items">his wrists</fex> <fex name="Manner">as tightly as possible</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects. It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs. <ex><fex name="Agent">The robber</fex> <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Item
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Item</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches to the <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> <fex name="Item">Harry</fex> to the chair.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an attaching event. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> his ankles <fex name="Result">together</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which an <fen>Item</fen> is attached. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry <fex name="Goal">to the chair</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Connector
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Connector</fen> forms the bond that maintains the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen> in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Connector">with a rope</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Items
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the plural <fen>Items</fen> that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> <fex name="Items">Harry's ankles</fex> together.</ex>
Notice that when the FE <fen>Items</fen> occurs, neither <fen>Item</fen> nor <fen>Goal</fen> can occur.</def-root>

Arg.name: Handle
Arg.definition: <def-root>Thie <fen>Handle</fen> is the point of attachment on the <fen>Item</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches. <ex>The robbers <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Handle">by his ankle</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Means">by wrapping the rope around his chest</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Manner">with enthusiasm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Place">in the basement</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Purpose">to stop him from leaving</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Time">at midnight</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an <fen>Agent</fen> attaches an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>. Typically, it transmits the force applied by the <fen>Agent</fen>, and is not left behind as a participant in the resultant Being_attached frame. <ex>The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair <fex name="Instrument">with his left hand</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Item</fen> ends up attached.
<ex>You only <fex name="Degr">partially</fex> <t>anchored</t> it, and now it's torn off.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times the Attaching event occurs per some unit of time. </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the Attaching event began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: fasten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fix or hold in place

lexUnit.name: attach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten; join

lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attach or fasten with string, cord, etc

lexUnit.name: tack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or fix with tacks or with temporary long stitches

lexUnit.name: glue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or join with glue

lexUnit.name: staple.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: secure with a staple or staples

lexUnit.name: tape.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten, attach, or mark off with tape

lexUnit.name: pin.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attach or fasten with a pin or pins

lexUnit.name: nail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten with a nail or nails.

lexUnit.name: affix.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attach or fasten to something else

lexUnit.name: chain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten, secure, or confine with a chain

lexUnit.name: paste.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stick with paste

lexUnit.name: sew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join, fasten, or repair by making stitches with a needle and thread or a sewing machine

lexUnit.name: stick.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: adhere or cause to adhere.

lexUnit.name: lash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten securely with a cord or rope

lexUnit.name: bond.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join or be joined securely to something else. with obj.

lexUnit.name: cinch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: secure with a belt

lexUnit.name: secure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make secure; fix or fasten securely

lexUnit.name: fuse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join, blend, or coalesce to form a single entity

lexUnit.name: shackle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: chain with shackles

lexUnit.name: bind.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fasten something together

lexUnit.name: detach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: disengage (something) and remove it

lexUnit.name: manacle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fetter with a manacle or manacles

lexUnit.name: handcuff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put handcuffs on

lexUnit.name: fetter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: restrain with fetters. as adj. fettered

lexUnit.name: rivet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join or fasten with a rivet or rivets

lexUnit.name: tether.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tie with a tether

lexUnit.name: cement.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fix with cement; bind together

lexUnit.name: gum.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: gummed, gumming with obj. cover or fasten with gum or glue

lexUnit.name: fix.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attach or position securely

lexUnit.name: weld.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join together (metal parts) by heating the surfaces to the point of melting and pressing or hammering them together

lexUnit.name: solder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join with solder

lexUnit.name: agglutinate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: firmly stick or be stuck together to form a mass

lexUnit.name: moor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make fast (a boat) by attaching it by cable or rope to the shore or to an anchor

lexUnit.name: anchor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: secure firmly in position

lexUnit.name: attachment [item].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an extra part or extension attached to perform a function.

lexUnit.name: hitch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or tether with a rope

lexUnit.name: tying.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the activity of attaching or fastening

lexUnit.name: untie.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: undo or unfasten

lexUnit.name: hook.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to attach or join together by means of a hook

lexUnit.name: plaster.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attach or fasten tightly to another surface

lexUnit.name: attachment [act].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of attaching

lexUnit.name: strap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or secure with a strap.

lexUnit.name: adhere.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to stick one item to another

lexUnit.name: append.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attaching one thing to another usually larger or more important one.

lexUnit.name: concatenate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: link together in a chain or series.

lexUnit.name: tack on.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: add or append something to something already existing.

lexUnit.name: yoke.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attach with a crosspiece

lexUnit.name: truss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bind or tie up tightly.

lexUnit.name: link.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join physically.

lexUnit.name: connect.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: join together

lexUnit.name: join.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to become linked or connected to.

lexUnit.name: mount.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fix in position

lexUnit.name: wire.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attach with wire

lexUnit.name: bracket.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: securely attach with a bracket (usually to a sturdy anchor, such as a wall).
